content: Now all the tax collectors and sinners [including non-observant Jews] were coming near Jesus to listen to Him.
Both the Pharisees and the scribes  muttering  complaining, saying, “This man accepts  welcomes sinners and eats with them.”
So He told them this parable:  [searching]

[each one equal to a day’s wages]   [women]   [that is, changes his inner self—his old way of thinking, regrets past sins, lives his life in a way that proves repentance; and seeks God’s purpose for his life].”

Then He said,   [inappropriately]   [that he had]     [carob]  [but they could not satisfy his hunger],   [finally]    [just]     [for the guest of honor]   [invite everyone and]   [as good as]   [celebration]     [so much as]   [other]    [as good as]
